column3: Most museums - with all their burdens to pay for exhibitions, administration, and security - really don't have any money really to acquire art, with few exceptions.

There's a snobbery at work in architecture. The subject is too often treated as a fine art, delicately wrapped in mumbo-jumbo. In reality, it's an all-embracing discipline taking in science, art, maths, engineering, climate, nature, politics, economics.
It is the spectator, and not life, that art really mirrors.
The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
The art of acceptance is the art of making someone who has just done you a small favor wish that he might have done you a greater one.
The art of life is to live in the present moment, and to make that moment as perfect as we can by the realization that we are the instruments and expression of God Himself.
We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.
The temple of art is built in words.
Cultural confinement takes place when a curator imposes his own limits on an art exhibition, rather than asking an artist to set his limits.
I think it is in collaboration that the nature of art is revealed.
I have nothing to hide in art. The initial force alone can bring anyone to the end he must attain.
In an era ruled by materialism and unstable geopolitics, art must be restored to the center of public education.
An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
That's why people listen to music or look at paintings. To get in touch with that wholeness.
The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure.
Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.
It is after all the greatest art to limit and isolate oneself.
Modern art is what happens when painters stop looking at girls and persuade themselves that they have a better idea.
Every time a student walks past a really urgent, expressive piece of architecture that belongs to his college, it can help reassure him that he does have that mind, does have that soul.
I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.
Great art picks up where nature ends.
Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.
Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
Religion and art spring from the same root and are close kin. Economics and art are strangers.
The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
